It is the entry point to one of the sierra's foothill areas in the Metropolitan region known as Cajón de Maipo, a sector with hiking trails, bridal paths and rafting, among other activities; it also has lodging and food services.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her chocolate shop and also thread, dyes, frames, wool and boxes for her crafts.

loans.name: Tété Kodjo

texts.fr:
Tété est un homme âgé de 30 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 01enfant de 02ans.
Tété travaille comme électricien et revendeur de matériels électriques depuis 1997. Il vend à toutes personnes et s’approvisionne à Lomé. 
Tété a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises. Il veut épargner. 
Dans les prochaines années, Tété voudrait augmenter le niveau de l’activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit de scolariser l’enfant et d’augmenter l’activité de la conjointe.
texts.en:
Tété is a 30-year old man. His wife is a vendor. They have a two-year old child. Since 1997, Tété  has been working as an electrician and vendor of electrical supplies. He sells to the general public and stocks up in Lomé.

Tété has requested his first credit from WAGES in order to buy more goods. He would like to make savings. In the years to come, Tété would like to expand his business. He says that, with his revenues, he plans to provide for his child’s education and to bolster his wife’s business.

loans.use: to buy electrical supplies

loans.name: Maura Maria

texts.es:
Maura tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 25, 21 y 16 años de edad,  los tres son independientes y viven fuera de su casa, ella vive con su madre  y  hermano en el Barrio El Centro de San Pedro Sula.
Doña Maura estableció su propio negocio de pulpería hace un año donde vende productos de alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, harina, arroz, manteca, etc. También ofrece producto de abarrotería y otros productos como comida de animales, (perro, gato y de pollo). Inicio su propio negocio con la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos del hogar y con mucho trabajo y dedicación ha podido salir adelante. Dedicándole todo el día.
Ella solicita un préstamo de 15,000 lempiras para invertir en compra productos alimenticios y de abarrotería como (huevos, aceite, harina, arroz, azúcar, maíz, etc. Para poder satisfacer el servicio a los clientes en cuanto a los productos que demandan.
Su meta es seguir trabajando en su negocio para obtener mejores ingresos que le ayuden a poder seguir pagando sus préstamos y poder comprar otra casa.
texts.en:
Maura, 45, is a single mother of three children who are 25, 21 and 16 years of age.  All three are independent and live away from home.  She lives with her mother and brother in Barrio El Centro in San Pedro Sula.

Maura set up her own grocery business a year ago where she sells food items like rice, beans, sugar, flour, rice, lard, etc.  She also sells grocery items like animal feed (dog, cat and chicken).  She started her own business needing to help with household expenses and with much work and dedication has been able to get ahead.  She works all day.

She is asking for a 15,000 lempira loan to buy food and grocery items like eggs, oil, flour, rice, sugar, corn, etc. to meet customer demand with respect to the products they request.  Her goal is to stay in business to earn better income that will help her continue repaying her loans and to be able to buy another house.

loans.use: to buy food and grocery items like eggs, oil, flour, rice, sugar, corn, etc.

location.town: Barrio El Centro. San Pedro Sula

loans.name: Pentalfa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PENTALFA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada.  Está compuesta por once integrantes que cuentan con una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Alejandra. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de juguetes y regalos, venta de productos de belleza, venta de calzados, venta de abarrotes, venta de zapatillas.

La señora Alejandra, indica que forma parte de una asociación comunal desde hace cuatro años atrás. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta regalos y juguetes, que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su cuñado. El crédito de este ciclo es para aumentar su capital (compra de juguetes y regalos) que adquirirá de las ferias y posteriormente lo comercializará de forma ambulante (sin puesto fijo). Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustó la capacitación en crédito y salud.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Rosario por razones culturales.
texts.en:
The “Pentalfa” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Tejada Focal Center.  It has eleven members led by a governing board headed by Alejandra.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of occupations.  Among them we have: clothing sales, toy and gift sales, beauty product sales, shoe sales, grocery sales and slipper sales.

Alejandra indicates that she’s been a member of a communal bank for four years.  Currently, she has a business selling gifts and toys that she’s had for years having learned it from her brother-in-law.  The loan this cycle is to increase working capital.  She will buy toys and gifts in street markets to then resell in an ambulatory fashion (no fixed stand).  This way of working allows her to support her family since she’s married and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the credit training and the health services.  

Due to cultural reasons, Rosario does not appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy toys and gift items.

loans.name: Karen Cecilia

texts.es:
Karen tiene 24 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres la cual se ubica en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por su agricultura y por la amabilidad de sus pobladores; Karen es una joven muy entusiasta gracias a su esfuerzo y el apoyo de sus padres quienes la animaron y la aconsejaron; inicio su negocio de venta de menús y pollo broaster, desde hace un año que Karen; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tienen buena sazon para la presparacion de sus platillos, por ello siempre regresan sus clientes.

Karen está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar implementos para decorar su local como espejos, adornos, sillas, así podrá tener un ambiente más acogedor y cómodo para los clientes y poder estar mejor implementado,lo que le permitirá tener mayor clientela y seguir trabajando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Terminar una carrera”.
texts.en:
Karen, 24, lives at home with her parents in the city of Imperial, a place known for agriculture and friendly people. Karen is a very enthusiastic young woman, thanks to her own hard work and the support of her parents who encourage and advise her. A year ago she started her business selling daily specials and roasted chicken. She thinks that her business is going well because her meals taste good and so her clients keep coming back.

Karen is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy things to set up her restaurant like mirrors, decorations and seats, so that she can have a more inviting and comfortable environment for her customers. Having a better set-up will allow her to have more customers and keep working to meet her biggest dream: finishing her degree.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, mirrors, and decorations

loans.name: Iludis

texts.es: Iludís quiere compartir su novedad con sus financiadores y es que gracias a su apoyo, ha podido hacer ahorros en sus ganancias del negocio, para organizar su casa en el macroproyecto que lidera la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, "Ciudad Bicentenario" de la ciudad de Cartagena. Ella esta muy entusiasmada con su crédito anterior porque compró mercancía variada y materiales para producir las comidas como son granos. Arroz espagueti etc. Ahora se prepara para recibir su segundo credikiva, onceavo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  en esta oportunidad comprará telas, hilos, encajes y todos los insumos que necesita para la producción de cortinas cubre lechos y lencería, porque quiere responde a sus costuras encargadas, en su otro negocio de confecciones, que realiza simultanemanete.
texts.en:
Iludes wishes to share her pleasure with her loans, and the fact that thanks to their help, she has been able to establish enough savings from her business earnings to organize her house in the macro-project sponsored by the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, “Ciudad Bicentenario” in the city of Cartagena. She is also very excited about her last loan; she bought varied merchandise and materials to produce meals, including grains, rice, spaghetti, etc. 

Now she is preparing to receive a 2nd “credikiva” (Kiva loan), her 11th loan arranged through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. On this occasion, she will buy cloth, thread, lace, and all necessary supplies to produce curtains, drapes, and linen, so she can fulfill orders in her other micro-business, drapery and curtain making.

loans.use: buy cloth, thread, lace, and all necessary supplies for her 2nd micro-business, making  curtains, drapes, and linens.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio, trabaja como chofer propietario dentro de un sindicato de transportes en la ciudad de La  Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo ya que es la única fuente de trabajo para mantener a su familia.
Julio, es soltero y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la casa de sus familiares en la zona Tembladerani ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Julio works as a taxi driver/owner within one of the city of La Paz’s transportation syndicates.  He needs the loan to service his vehicle since it’s his only source of income to support his family.

Julio is single and has two children that he lives with in a house belonging to relatives located in the city of La Paz’s Tembladerani zone.  

This is the first time he works with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luís, trabaja como chofer propietario de un micro bus dentro de un sindicato de transportes en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo ya que es la única fuente con la que cuenta para ayudar a su familia
José Luís, es soltero y tiene tres hijos con los cuales vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
José Luis works as a driver/owner of a minibus in one of the city of La Paz’s transportation syndicates.  He needs the loan to service his vehicle since it’s his only source of income to support his family.

José Luis is single and has three children he lives with in his parents’ house in the city of La Paz’s Sopocachi zone.

This is the third time he’s worked with IMPRO and the second with KIVA.

loans.use: to pay to service his minibus.

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is 28 years old and married with a four-year-old child. For the past eight years, he has been a tea farmer in Kipsigak and he earns a good income. He has successfully repaid three previous loans from KADET LTD.

Mike is requesting a 50,000 KES loan from KADET LTD to purchase fertilizer and to pay laborers. He will use the profits from his loan to expand his tea plantation. Mike hopes to own more tea zones in the area and also to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and hire laborers

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 32 years old, married, and has two children. He sells beans, peas, rice, and maize to earn a living, which he has been doing for three years.  Justus employs one person. 

Justus is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy beans, peas, rice, and maize.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business and hopes to expand further in the future.

loans.use: to buy beans, peas, rice, and maize to sell

loans.name: Fanuel

texts.en: Fanuel, a 37-year-old married father of three who has been selling fish to earn a living for two years, describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. Fanuel is now requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy fish for resale.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 28 years old and married with one child. For the past three years, he has been selling sweaters, blouses, and skirts to earn a living. Stephen has employed one person. He works as a farmer to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Stephen has been able to save his income.

Stephen is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy sweaters, blouses, and skirts to sell. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, blouses, and skirts to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, a 40-year-old single mother of one child, has been running a hotel for the past ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,000 which she uses to support her family.

Her previous loans repaid, she is now requesting her third one from KADET LTD. to buy a stock of sugar and rice for her business. With the anticipated profit from her enterprise, Lydia will educate her child. Her dream is to open a nursery school.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar and rice for her business.

loans.name: Evanson

texts.en:
Evanson is 62 years old and is married to Grace, a businesswoman. The couple is blessed with five children. For the past 11 years, Evanson has been a mixed crop farmer and he earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES which he uses to support his family. He has successfully repaid three previous loans with KADET LTD.

Evanson is requesting his fourth KADET LTD loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. He will use the anticipated profit from his loan to educate his children. Evanson's hopes and dreams are to buy a pickup to offer transportation.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is 45 years old and is married with three children: two daughters and a son. She lives in Ijevan. Karine's elder daughter is married and lives separately from parents, her son lives in Russia, and her youngest daughter is a student. Since 1995, Karine and her husband have run a cereal and fodder trading business. They buy products from villagers, stock them in their house, and then sell them to the local food market. Thanks to their business income, Karine and her husband are able to support their family and were able to organize their daughter’s wedding. 

Karine is requesting a 700,000 AMD loan to buy wholesale cereal and fodder to resell. She has been a client of Nor Horizon for many years.

loans.use: to buy cereal and fodder to resesll

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old and is married with two children. For the past five years, she has run a grocery store. Mary describes her business environment as good because she faces limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business.

Mary is requesting a 60,000 KES loan to buy beans, peas, and maize to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy beans, peas, and maize to sell

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 36 years old and is married with two children. For the past five years, he has sold glass to earn a living. To earn extra income, Michael also is a poultry farmer. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income.

Michael is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to buy glass to sell. In the future, he hopes to expand his business to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy glass to sell

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 51 years old, married, and the mother of five children between the ages of 11 and 25. Her husband is a dairy farmer. For the past eight years, Pauline has owned a store where she sells cereals. She earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES. 

Pauline is requesting her first KADET LTD loan of 20,000 KES to purchase two sacks of dry beans for 12,000 KES and four sacks of dry maize 8,000 KES. She will use the profit from her loan to repay what she owes and to pay school fees. Pauline's dream is to prosper in business.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is 25 years old and married with three children. For the past three years, she has run a general store to earn a living. Peris describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income.

Peris is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy beans, peas, and shoes to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy beans, peas, and shoes to sell

loans.name: Rasiya

texts.en:
Bai Tushum and Partners expresses gratitude to all Kiva lenders who helped Rasiya obtain her first Kiva loan, which she used as intended and repaid. She was able to increase her herd and increase her sales of milk and meat products. 

Rasiya is now applying for a 120,000 KGS loan to purchase additional cattle. She will use the profit from her loan to buy a car to transport her products.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Dieudonné

texts.fr:
Dieudonné(Jeune homme en chemise blanche avec chapeau) est un homme âgé de 26 ans. Il est marié å une ménagère. Il a 01 enfant âgé d’01an.  
Dieudonné travaille comme revendeur de baffles et amplis depuis 2002. Il vend à toutes personnes dans la zone portuaire.
Dieudonné a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des baffles et des amplis. Il veut ouvrir une boutique pour assurer un avenir radieux à son enfant.
texts.en:
Dieudonné (the young man in the white shirt and hat) is twenty-six years old.  His wife takes care of the home.  They have one child who is a year old. 
Dieudonné has been selling baffles and amplifiers since 2002.  He sells to the general public in the area near the port. 
Dieudonné received his second loan through WAGES in order to buy baffles and amplifiers. He wants to open a shop to help assure a bright future for his child.

loans.use: to buy baffles and amplifiers.

loans.name: Ndolo

texts.en:
Ndolo is 58 years old and married with six children. For the past seven years, he has sold spare motor vehicle parts to earn a living. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Ndolo has been able to educate his children.

Ndolo is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to buy vehicle tires to sell. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy vehicle tires to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 37 years old, married, and has three children. He sells charcoal to earn a living, which he has been doing for six years. Daniel employs one person. 

Daniel is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy charcoal to sell. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business and hopes to further expand in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Bubukharia

texts.en: Bai Tushum and Partners expresses gratitude to all Kiva lenders who helped Bubukharia obtain her first Kiva loan, which was used as intended and repaid. She was able to increase her herd and her sales of milk and meat products. Now Bubukharia has applied for a loan of 50,000 KGS for purchasing additional cattle. It will allow her to continue to increase her sales of milk and dairy products.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Jack

texts.en: Jack, 28, is a married man with seven children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been dealing in produce for the last six years. He started as a peasant farmer growing Irish potatoes. He saved some money, which he used to start his current business. Jack needs the loan to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize

loans.name: Deogratias

texts.en:
Deogratias is 40 years old and lives in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a retail shop in the same town.

Deogratias is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy sugar for selling at his shop. He dreams of becoming a wholeseller and educating his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 28-year-old married man, living in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

His desire is to have a family business. He started as a farmer and later got a shop which he has run for three years. He intends to invest the loan in buying sugar, flour, and general merchandise for his business.

He dreams of turning his retail shop into a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, and general shop merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Sarapio

texts.en: Sarapio, 31, is a married man with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has dealt in produce for the last 12 years. He started as a peasant farmer and saved some money. He used his savings to start his current business, which is very profitable. His family dream is to educate his children. His business dream is to have a sustainable food store. Sarapio intends to use the loan to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 45-year-old married man from Al Russeifeh, Jordan and a father of five children.

Raed has a grocery store and he is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase goods for business purposes.

Raed is looking to expand his store and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase goods for his store

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Yusra is a 35-year-old married woman from Al Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan and a mother of four children. She has a grocery store and is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase a freezer for frozen food.

Yusra is looking to expand her business and open another branch of her store.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer for frozen food

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Ama est une femme âgé(e) de 41 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 04 enfants, dont 03 à l’école. Le premier a 12 ans et le dernier a 06ans.  
Ama travaille comme revendeuse de bois de chauffe depuis 2009. Elle vend seule à la maison et achète les marchandises à Lomé. 
Ama a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bois de chauffe. Elle veut avoir une boutique.
Dans les prochaines années, Ama voudrait avoir un dépôt de vente de bois de chauffe. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d'assurer les meilleures conditions de vie à sa famille.
texts.en:
Ama is a forty-one year old woman.  She is married to a salesman.  They have four children, three of whom attend school.  The oldest is 12 years old and the youngest is 6.
Ama has been selling firewood since 2009.  She sells alone from her house and buys her supplies in Lomé. 
Ama received her first loan from WAGES in order to buy firewood.  She wants to open a store. 
In the years to come, Ama would like to have a warehouse for selling her firewood.  She says that with the profits, she could assure the best living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells maize porridge. She lives together with her four children at Nyame Bekyere. 

Ekua has been selling maize porridge for four years now. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize to prepare her porridge for sale. With the new profit, Ekua will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to prepare her porridge for sale.

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr: Lamine est un paysan qui exploite des terres qu'il a hérité de son père.A la fin de l'hivernage durant laquelle il cultive du mil et de l'arachide, il pratique le maraîchage avec des spéculations comme l'oignon, le choux, la salade et le piment...Cette diversité d'activité lui assure des revenus durant les 12 mois de l'année et lui permet de faire face aux besoins de sa famille.Il est marié et père de quatre enfants.afin d'augmenter ses surface de culture, il sollicite un pret de 150000f pour d'acheter des semences de piment et d'oignons.Il ambitionne d'acheter une motopompe pour faciliter l'extraction d'eau de ses puits.
texts.en:
Lamine is a farmer who works with land that he inherited from his father. At the end of the rainy season, during which he grows millet and groundnuts, he switches to market gardening to grow onions, cabbage, lettuce and peppers. Such diversity allows him to generate income throughout all twelve months of the year, which helps him to provide for his family. He is a married father of four children. 

He would like to expand his farmable area, and is now seeking a loan of 150,000F to buy onion and peppers seeds. His goal is to buy a draining pump to assist in extracting water from his wells.

loans.use: to buy onion and pepper seeds.

loans.name: Kareema

texts.en:
Kareema is a 51-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan.

Kareema sells clothes and blankets and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more quantities for business purposes. She is looking to establish her own shop for her business and purchase a car for the family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and blankets for business purposes

loans.name: Amena

texts.en:
Amena is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Amena is a 33-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan and a mother of five children. She sells cosmetics and works out of her home.

Amena is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more quantities of cosmetic products for business purposes. An aspiration of Amena is to establish a beauty centre.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics products for business purposes

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a sixty-three-year-old woman who is widowed and has five children. She was a teacher who retired from civil service to start up a poultry farm in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

She hopes to grow her business and sustain her family. She also wants to buy land on which to grow crops to add to her sources of income.

loans.use: to buy chickens for rearing.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 58-year-old widow. She operates an agro-vet shop and has been in the business for the past six years. She earns a monthly income of 7,000 KES from the business.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was brought to KADET LTD  by one of our clients. She will use the loan amount to purchase more fertilizer and seeds for sale. Her dream is to own a hardware shop.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Barnabas

texts.en:
Barnabas is 26 years old and single.  He owns a motorcycle that he uses for transport services, which he has been doing for two years.  He earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

Barnabas is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD for 20,000 KES, which he will use purchase another motorcycle.  The profits will be used to repay the loan and improve his living standards.  He hopes to own a taxi car in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Humberto de 41 años vive en el municipio de San Jacinto, en el departamento de Bolívar,  tierra de las hamacas y artesanías en tejido vertical. Su familia está conformada por su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 12 a 17 años de edad. Su madre en su cultura artesanal forma parte de un grupo en esta población muy bien organizado y esto lo inspiró para vender los productos artesanales. En su negocio trabaja él y su esposa, quien es una artesana titulada por el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje “Sena”, organización que controla el estado nacional, para el desarrollo educativo de carreras técnicas y tecnológicas, por eso ella conoce no solo las artesanías de su cultura, sino también las de otras regiones del país. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, porque se prepara con un buen inventario  de hamacas, bolsos y mochilas, así es que comprará en mayor volumen hilazas para hamacas, paquete de hilo fino para bolsos y mochilas y también pitas de madejas. Esto le alcanzara para fabricar 10 hamacas, 50 bolsos y el resto en mochilas. El éxito de la inversión radica en que ya no tendrá que comprar productos donde otros proveedores, porque así ocurre usualmente debido a que su mercado está creciendo,  sino que tendrá un stock de oferta que ofrecer y su experiencia radica en saber venderlos y tener lo que sus clientes necesitan.
texts.en:
Humberto, aged 41, lives in the town of San Jacinto, in the department of Bolívar.  This is a land of hammocks and craftsmen who do vertical weaving.  Humberto's family is made up of his wife and four children, who are aged between 12 and 17 years.  His mother makes cultural handicrafts, and is part of a very well organized group in this town, which is what inspired Humberto to sell artisinal products.

He and his wife both work in his business, which is a handicrafts business authorized by the "Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje" ["National Apprenticeship Service"], or "SeNA" for short, organization.  SeNA is a state organization for educational development for technical and technological careers.  For this reason, they do not just sell handicrafts from their own culture, but also those from other regions of the country.

He is currently applying for this Kiva loan because he is preparing a good inventory of hammocks, bags, and backpacks.  The loan will allow him to purchase supplies in greater volume, buying yarn for hammocks, a packet of fine yarn for bags and backpacks, and also skeins of agave fiber.  With this he will be able to make ten hammocks and fifty bags, and use the rest for the backpacks.

The success of this investment lies in the fact that he will not need to purchase products as other suppliers do, which normally happens due to growing sales, but he will have a supply of stock to offer for sale.  His experience resides in knowing how to sell and have in stock what his customers need.

loans.use: to purchase supplies in greater volume, buying yarn for hammocks, a packet of fine yarn for bags and backpacks, and also skeins of agave fiber

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and has four children. She lives in Changamwe. She owns a café, which has been running for nine months. Sarah also sells clothes to the residents of her neighborhood. She began both businesses from her savings. 

Sarah wants to diversify her sources of income and has decided to engage in the transport business. She is requesting a loan for 90,000 KES, which she will use to purchase a motorcycle.
 
Sarah’s current business faces the challenge of overall inflation in the country and some clients not paying on time.  She believes that the transport business has a brighter future, which will enable her to buy a van for transport. The additional income from this loan will help Sarah pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en:
Norayr is 49 years old. He lives in Ijevan. Norayr is married and has two children: a son and a daughter. His daughter is married and lives separately from her parents; his son is a student at the Ijevan branch of Yerevan State University. 

Norayr worked for many years at a public catering association and bread-baking plant. Since 2005, he has been running his own business: confectionery production. He runs his business in his own garage, which he has re-equipped for confectionery production. Norayr’s wife and son help him in the business and thus they fulfill private orders and provide the Tavush region food shops with their production. Thanks to the business, Norayr’s family supports themselves and pays for their son’s education as well.

This is Norayr’s fourth loan from Nor Horizon. Now he is asking for a 500,000 AMD loan to buy wholesale flour, sugar, and butter for his production.

loans.use: to buy wholesale flour, sugar, and butter for his confectionery production.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna, vive con su familia, y su hija de 34 años, Doña Reyna se dedica a la venta de mercería y pescado seco, ella tiene una larga experiencia en el negocio, ofrece artículos como prendedores, colas, pulseras, tiene el puesto en el mercado, lo atiende a tiempo completo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de prendedores, accesorios, pescado seco, y otros materiales para surtir el negocio, esto incrementara la oportunidad de mejorar las ventas.
La aspiración de doña Reyna es mejorar la vivienda y continuar con la construcción de un pozo artesanal en la vivienda, para mejorar la disponibilidad de agua en la casa, ya que no cuenta con este vital liquido.
texts.en:
Reyna lives with her family and her 34-year-old daughter.  Doña Reyna works selling accessories and dried fish.  She has a great deal of experience in this business, and sells items such as brooches, necklaces and bracelets.  She has a stall in the market where she works full-time.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of brooches, accessories, dried fish, and other materials for stocking up her business.  This will increase her opportunity for improving her sales.

Doña Reyna's goal is to improve her home and continue construction on a well for her home.  This will improve access to water in her house, as right now she doesn't have access to this vital liquid.

loans.use: to purchase brooches, accessories and dried fish.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: AMY est une femme mariée, mère de 5 enfants dont trois filles et deux garçons.Elle exerce un commerce de tissus qu'elle achète dans un pays limitrophe chaque trois mois.Le produits est placé à crédit auprès de ses clients qui paient au bout de deux mois.Avec les revenus tirés de cette activité, elle s'occupe de ses enfants et prend aussi en charge ses propres besoins. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite auprès de UIMCEC un pret de 200000f pour acheter 5 douzaine de rouleaux de tissus. Elle ambitionne de construire une cantine devant son domicile.
texts.en:
AMY is a married woman and the mother of three girls and two boys. She has a business involving fabrics, which she buys from a bordering nation every three months. The goods are provided on credit to customers who pay at the end of two months. 

With the revenues derived from this business, AMY takes care of her children and also meets her own needs. 

In order to bolster her business capital, she is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs from UIMCEC to buy five dozen rolls of cloth. Her ambition is to build a stall in front of her home.

loans.use: to buy 5 dozen rolls of cloth

loans.name: Silvia Vanessa

texts.es: La señora Silvia  actualmente vive por el zona Virgen de Lujan solicitante vive en vivienda familiar en la casa de sus Padres, la clienta se dedica a la venta de anticuchos desde hace mas de ocho años los anticuchos es una comida tradicional de nuestro país lleva carne menudencia de la vaca y papa, son como las brochetas, la clienta vende en uno de los mercados mas concurridos de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  La Sra. Silvia destinara su crédito a la compra de un frízer para su negocio. La clienta agradeció a la institución por la oportunidad brindada y por la rapidez con la que se le atendió, ya que le permite crecer en su actividad, mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Silvia currently lives in the neighborhood of Virgen de Lujan, and lives with her family in her parents' home.  She has been working selling snacks for more than eight years.  Her snacks are traditional food from our country using offal and potatoes such as skewered kebabs.  She sells at one of the busiest markets in the city of Santa Cruz.

Señora Silvia intends to use her loan to purchase a freezer for her business.  She is grateful to the financing institution for the opportunity provided and for the speed with which they have responded to her, as this allows her to grow her business, and improve her income and ultimately quality of life for her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer

loans.name: Pape Cheikh

texts.fr: Pape Cheikh est un homme marié, père de trois enfants. Il exerce le métier de conducteur de camion de transport de produits fruitiers notamment des mangues.Cette activité génère des revenus assez importants surtout durant la période de grande production.Son activité lui permet de prendre en charge l'essentiel des dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Aujourd'hui, pour réparer son camion qui souffre d'une panne, il sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter des amortisseurs. Son ambition est d'acheter un autre véhicule.
texts.en:
Pape Cheikh is a married man and a father of three children. He works in the truck driving trade transporting fruits, notably mangoes. This business generated large enough revenues, especially during this high-output period. His business enables him to cover the essential expenses of caring for his family. 

Today, to repair his truck, which has broken down, Pape Cheikh is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to buy some shock absorbers. His ambition is to buy another vehicle.

loans.use: acheter des amortisseurs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a pool table.

loans.name: Jesús Angela

texts.es:
En Los Bajos del Cantón Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jesús, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  19, 12 y 9 años, los dos menores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo trabaja de ebanista.
 
Ella para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, los días que más vende son los fines de semana  y son los días cuando sale a recorrer, también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene más de 7  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ha podido sacar adelante a negocio. 

Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
The members of the "Madres Unidas" communal bank meet every two weeks in Los Bajos in Montecristi canton, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as for example, toquilla straw hats (also called Panama hats), which are well-known inside and outside the country. 

This is where we met Jesús. She is 43, married, and has three children, ages 19, 12 and 9. The two youngest go to school. Her husband works as a cabinetmaker. 
 
In order to earn her own income, and help her husband with the household expenses, she sells clothing of all kinds. She sells door to door, and sells the most on the weekends. Those are the days she goes out on her rounds. She also sells in her home where she has a small shop. 

She extends credit to her clients, and collects every two weeks. She goes to Guayaquil every two weeks to buy her merchandise; or every month, depending on her needs. She has been doing this work for more than seven years and it's going very well.

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing. She has been in the communal bank since it started, and likes it, because thanks to the loans she has been able to keep her business going. Her dream is to see her children complete their education and have good professions.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is married to a mason and has three children.  She sells waakye (rice and beans cooked together) and she has been in business for 11 years.  She serves it with gari (a couscous like grain made from grated cassava), macaroni, meat and fish stew.  She uses her income to help her husband pay their children’s school fees.  

Salamatu needs this loan in order to purchase bags of rice, beans and other ingredients for the preparation of the waakye she sells.  With the new profit, Salamatu will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans and other ingredients for the preparation of the waakye she sells.

loans.name: Estrella Del Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Estrella del Futuro” está conformado por 17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran la venta de ropa, preparación de comida rápida, confección de ropa, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de San Bernardo.
Patricia integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila de pié, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una polera color negro, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa recogido. Además en sus manos sostiene una carpeta de la institución, como referencia se encuentra detrás del emprendedor que viste polera color rojo. 
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente vendiendo ropa nueva para adultos, niños y también ropa de casa. Desde hace 4 años, ofrece sus productos a domicilio y también se instala con un puesto en la feria, algunos días de la semana. 
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras, específicamente en el barrio Meiggs (Barrio de carácter comercial) y de acuerdo a cada temporada, para fiestas, durante invierno y verano.
Con el crédito comprará sabanas y ropa de niño, aprovechará la temporada escolar.
Una de las metas para su negocio es instalarse con un local establecido.
Patricia vive junto a su marido, su hijo de 6 años de edad y además espera a su futuro hijo, ya que tiene 3 meses de embarazo. 
Uno de sus sueños a nivel personal es obtener su casa propia, ya que en la actualidad vive en la casa de sus padres.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Y respecto al grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, ella se siente muy cómoda, ya que además comparte con los demás emprendedores.
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur desde la plaza de armas de Santiago (capital de Chile). Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called “Estrella del Futuro” (Star of the Future). It is comprised of 17 entrepreneurs working on diverse segments such as clothing and fast food. They all live in the city of San Bernardo.
Patricia is a member of this Communal Bank. In the picture she appears standing on the second row, second place from right to left, wearing a black shirt and dark hair that is pulled back. She is holding a folder of the institution and is standing behind a male entrepreneur in a red shirt.  
Patricia sells new clothes for adults and children, as well as linens. She has been offering her products for four years, visiting her customers at their home and also at a market stand during some days of the week. 
She buys her products from wholesalers, specifically in the Meiggs neighborhood (known for its commercial orientation) and plans for every season: the holidays, winter and summer. 
With this loan she will buy linens and children’s clothing, taking into account the beginning of the school year. One of her business goals is to have an established shop. She lives with her husband and a 6-year-old son. She is also three months pregnant. One of her personal dreams is to own her house because they now live with her parents.
Patricia is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given her to invest in her business. She also feels very comfortable with her Communal Bank and she likes sharing with other entrepreneurs. 
San Bernardo is a town located 18 km. to the south of Santiago’s main square. It is known as the capital of folklore because every year in January it hosts the “International Folklore Festival,” an event where the country’s roots come together and groups of musicians from all South America meet. This town also hosts the “Traditional Handcraft Fair”, where artisans from Chile and neighboring countries meet. Also, the town hosts the “Abril cuecas mil” event in April, when all the community dances cueca (traditional Chilean dance).

loans.use: Comprará sabanas y ropa de niño, aprovechará la temporada escolar.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima sells charcoal at Nyame Bekyere and she has been in business for five years.  In front of Alima are packages of charcoal ready for sale.  She is married and has seven children.  Her husband is a retried security officer.  She uses her income to help her husband pay their utility bills. 

Alima will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business, Alima hopes to produce the charcoal herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Idrissa, est employé dans une usine de la place. Il est né en 1957 et va bientôt faire valoir ses droits à la retraite. Et pour préparer  cela il veut investir dans une activité génératrice de revenus telle la location de chaises. Il sollicite donc un crédit de 150000F CFA pour l’achat de chaises en plastiques.
Il est marié et a de grands enfants qui l’appui dans la dépense quotidienne. I l possède aussi comme revenus les fruits d’un local qu’il a mis en location. Tout cela l’aide à subvenir aux besoins des membres de sa famille. Comme projet futur après sa retraite il voudrait se lancer carrément dans les affaires et s’investir  entièrement.
texts.en:
Idrissa works in a local factory. He was born in 1957 and will soon be taking up his statutory retirement right. In order to prepare for this time, he wants to invest in an income generating activity - such as the hiring of chairs. Thus he is seeking a loan of 150000F CFA in order to purchase plastic chairs. He is married and has grown up children who assist with the daily expenses. He also gets an income from renting out a room. All that helps him to meet the needs of the family. 
In the future, after his retirement, he would like to get fully involved and throw himself totally into business.

loans.use: to purchase plastic chairs for hiring out.

loans.name: Alba Aurora

texts.es:
Alba,vive con su esposo y su hija, es comerciante, tiene su negocio de lácteos en el mercado, todos los días de la semana desde las 9:00 am hasta que termina la venta.
Actualmente solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como: queso, crema, requesón, cuajada, de esa manera podrá siempre mantener su negocio y conseguir más clientes.
La aspiración de Alba es que su negocio crezca, solo de esa manera podrá ser más rentable y podrá lograr darle a su familia lo mejor que ellos necesitan.
texts.en: Alba lives with her husband and daughter; she is a trader, and every day, from 9 o’clock in the morning until the market closes, she runs her dairy business in the market. She is currently requesting the loan to buy more merchandise, such as cheese, cream, cottage cheese and junket, this way she will always be able to keep her business and gain more clients. Alba’s aspiration is that her business grows, only by doing this will she be able to be more profitable and succeed in giving her family the best of what they need.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, cottage cheese and junket.

loans.name: Adil

texts.ru:
Eto vtoraya ssuda Adil, on blagopoluchno i bez zaderjek oplatil pervuyu ssudu. On ochen blagodaren Lenderam i Kive za pomosh. 
Adil jenat i imeyet 2 sinovey. Adil projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy jenoy i detmi. On uje  8 let kak zanimayetsya selskim xozaystvom. Adil 41 qod. On seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit udobreniya dlya oplodotvoreniya pochvi chtobi poluchit ludshiy urojay i tem samim razvit svoy bizness.
texts.en:
This is Adil's second loan, as he repaid his first loan in full and without any delays.  He's very grateful to Kiva and Kiva lenders for all the help.  

Adil is married and has two sons.  He lives in Absheron region with his lovely wife and children.  Adil is 41 years old, and he's been engaged in farming business for 8 years. He's requesting a loan of 2000 AZN to purchase fertilizer for his land to improve his harvest and thus develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two heifers.

loans.name: Djiby

texts.fr:
Djiby est un jeune couturier âgé de 28 ans qui s’active depuis 1998. Il possède son propre atelier ou il travaille avec d’autres jeunes tailleurs. Djiby est très assidu au travaille ce qui lui a valu d’emporter  récemment « le ciseau d’or » de sa ville d’appartenance. Il est marié et grâce aux revenus de son activité, il satisfait les besoins quotidiens de son foyer  et ceux liés à l’exploitation.
Avec le crédit, il veut réfectionner son atelier pour qu’il soit plus présentable. Comptant sur l’appui des préteurs il pense à agrandir un jour son atelier voire ouvrir un autre à coté.
texts.en:
Djiby is a young dressmaker, 28 years old, who has been in the business since 1998. He has his own workshop where he works with other young tailors. Djiby is very dedicated in his work - a fact which recently helped him win the "golden scissors" award in his town. He is married, and due to the income from his business, he is able to meet his household expenses as well as those of the business. With the loan, he wants to redecorate his workshop so that it is more presentable.
With the help of lenders, he intends one day to enlarge his workshop or even open another one at the side.

loans.use: to renovate his dressmaking workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy blouses, skirts, shorts, pants, and shirts.

loans.name: Sérigne

texts.fr: Sérigne est un homme marié qui pratique l'agriculture depuis son jeune age.Aujourd'hui, il s'est reconverti au maraîchage qu'il exerce en toute saison.Il exploite des parcelles à quelques kilomètres de son village dans un verger ou il a creusé deux puits.Actuellement il effectue une récolte par mois et la vente de la production lui procure des revenus importants dont une partie sert aux dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter des semences d'oignons , d'aubergine et de piment. Il ambitionne de s'équiper en motopompe.
texts.en:
Sérigne is a married man who has farmed since he was young. These days, he has switched to kitchen gardening, which he does year round. He works on plots of land a few kilometres from his village in an orchard where he has dug two wells. Currently, he has one harvest per month and the sale of the produce provides him with significant income - some of which is used to cover the family' household expenses. 
He is requesting a loan of 250,000f to purchase onion, aubergine and pepper seeds. His ambition is to get a motorised pump.

loans.use: to purchase onion, aubergine and pepper seeds

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta, vive en casa propia junto con su esposo y dos hijos, es comerciante, tiene su negocio de ropa para damas y caballeros desde hace 5 años, atendiendo todos los dias de la semana.
Ella solicita su préstamo para comprar más mercadería como blusas, pantalones, camisas y ropa interior. Esto le ayudara a surtir mejor su negocio y así ofrecer mejores prendas a los clientes.
El objetivo de Marta es mantener el negocio estable y surtido para tener más clientela y con las ganancias mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Marta lives in her own house together with her husband and two children.  She is a merchant.  She has had her business of selling men’s and women’s clothes for five years.  She tends to her business every day of the week.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise like blouses, pants, shirts, and underwear.  This will help her to better stock her business, and she will offer her customers better garments.

Marta’s objective is to keep the business stable and stocked in order to have more customers.  She uses the income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, shirts, and underwear.

loans.name: Nelly Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nelly, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene tres hijos de 14, 16 y 18 años de edad, ella ha realizado la siembra agrícola desde hace  6 años, trabaja todos los días, sus hijos le ayudan a sembrar, hasta la fecha no ha tenido inconvenientes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para el arrendamiento del terreno, ya que estará iniciando el cultivo de maíz y frijol, este préstamo le ayudara para poder garantizar el terreno en el que se dispone a sembrar.
La aspiración de Nelly es que sus hijos sigan estudiando, colaborar con ellos a través de los ingresos que obtiene del trabajo, para que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Nelly works growing corn and beans.  She has three children, ages 14, 16, and 18.  She has been farming for six years.  She works every day.  Her children help her plant.  She has not had any problems up to the present.

She is requesting a loan to rent land because she will be starting to grow corn and beans.  This loan will help her be able to guarantee the land on which she is ready to plant.

Nelly's goal is for her children to continue studying, to help them with the income she makes from her job so they can improve themselves.

loans.use: to rent land.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Ousmane est un jeune marié.Il est père de deux enfants dont l'un va à l'école primaire. Il est né dans une famille dont l'activité principale a toujours été l'élevage traditionnelle.Face au rétrécissement des espaces pastorales, il s'est retourné vers l'embouche bovine qui est beaucoup plus rentable.Il achète des bœufs qu'il engraisse et les revend. Cela lui rapporte beaucoup et lui permet de subvenir correctement aux besoins de sa famille.Ainsi,afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter 2 boeufs.
texts.en: Ousmane is a young married man. He is the father of two children, one of whom attends primary school. He was born into a family whose main business has always been traditional animal rearing. Faced with reducing pasture land, he has focused on cattle fattening which is much more profitable. He purchases cattle which he fattens and then sells on. He earns a good living from this, which allows him to adequately meet the family's needs. Therefore, in order to increase his working capital, he is requesting a loan of 300,000f to purchase 2 cows.

loans.use: to purchase 2 cows

loans.name: Santos Alejandra

texts.es:
Santos, vive con su familia, sus cuatro hijos de 17, 16, 14 y 12 años de edad, todos son dependientes, ella inicio con el negocio de cosméticos por la necesidad de tener una ocupación que le ayudara para generar dinero para las necesidades del hogar, ella visita casa por casa de los clientes, con revistas de cosméticos, donde se le encargan los productos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de un pedido de cosméticos, como labiales, lociones, cremas, maquillajes, entre otros productos de belleza que los clientes le encargan, este préstamo le ayudara para comprar el pedido que luego por medio de crédito le pagaran los clientes.
La aspiración de Santos es crecer sus hijos con todo lo necesario, dándoles la educación, alimentación necesaria, además de fortalecer el negocio para generar más ganancias.
texts.en:
Santos lives with her family.  She has four children aged 17, 16, 14 and 12, all of whom are dependent on her.  She began her beauty products business out of the need for an occupation that would help her earn money for household necessities.  She goes to her customers' homes with the beauty products catalogs from which she orders her products.

She is requesting a loan for purchasing an order of beauty products.  This includes items such as lipsticks, lotions, creams, and make-up, with other beauty products that her customers order.  This loan will help her to purchase the order, which her customers will later pay for through credit.

Santos' goal is to raise her children with everything they need, to provide them with education and food, and additionally to strengthen her business to generate more earnings.

loans.use: to purchase an order of beauty products (lipstick, lotions, creams, make-up)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various types of fish, shrimp, and conch.

loans.name: Poussi Jacque

texts.fr:
Mr POUSSI  JACQUE. Il est marié  et sans  enfant. Personne ne va à l’école et il a 01 personne à sa charge.

Mr vend des vêtements. Elle exerce ce métier depuis  04ans. Il s’approvisionne au marché  de secteur 10 en ville et à Lomé. Ses clients sont  particulièrement les  hommes.

Mr  veut  s’acheter  02 douzaines de jean ; 01 douzaine de body et 05 paires de chaussures.

Il  épargne  ses bénéfices  pour réinvestir dans son activité. Mr ambitionne agrandir  son atelier de 02 mètre  et épargner pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Jacque Poussi is married without children. No-one attends school and he has one dependent. He sells clothing. He has been doing this for 4 years. He buys his stock in the sector 10 market in town, and also in Lomé. His customers are mostly men.
He wants to buy 2 dozen pairs of jeans, 1 dozen shirts and 5 pairs of shoes. He saves his profits to re-invest in his business. His ambition is to extend his shop-floor by 2 metres and to save for his family.

loans.use: to buy 2 dozen pairs of jeans, a dozen shirts and 5 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Yafane

texts.fr: Yafane pratique l'embouche ovine. Il achète des moutons de race, les engraisse pendant 8 mois et les rend sur les marchés locaux.Cela lui rapporte des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et de ses cinq enfants.Il parvient à prendre aussi en charge les frais de scolarité de ces derniers.Afin de faire une nouvelle opération, il sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter 3 moutons. Il ambitionne de s'engager plus tard dans l'embouche bovine.
texts.en: Yafane raises sheep. He buys purebred sheep, fattens them for eight months and then resells at the local markets. This business provides him with a relatively steady income allowing him to support his wife and five children. He also manages to take care of the children's education costs. In order to start any cycle, he is seeking a loan of 200,000  in order to buy three sheep.  In the future, he plans to start raising cattle.

loans.use: to buy three sheep

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: El señor Jesús actualmente vive por la zona de virgen de Cotoca la casa es de su propiedad,  El Sr. Jesús se dedica a la venta de gaseosas coca cola y dulces por la zona del segundo anillo, leva muy bien con su actividad ya que cuenta con buenos ingresos, y esto le permite mantener su familia, el Sr. Jesús  se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 6 años. El dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de material de construcción para la construcción de un cuarto de su casa y así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia El solicitante agradeció a la institución por la oportunidad brindada y también agradeció por la rapidez con la que se lo atendió.
texts.en:
Jesús is currently living in the Virgin of Cotoca area, and owns his own house. Jesús sells soft drinks, Coca Cola and candy in the Segundo Anillo area. His business is going very well, as he has a good income, and this allows him to support his family. Jesús has been doing this work for six years. 

He will use the loan money to buy construction materials to build a room in his house, and so offer greater comfort to his family. The borrower is thankful to the institution for the opportunity he has been given, and also appreciates how quickly he was dealt with.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish building a room in his home.

loans.name: Aydalina Del Carmen

texts.es: Aydalina del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedoras quien se dedica a la elaboración de calzado desde hace 6 años. Ella invertirá en materia prima brazil, galleta, azulón, suela, pega, plantillas…etc. Ella trabaja junto a su esposo Jaime con el cual tiene dos niños.
texts.en: Aydalina del Carmen is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has been making shoes for six years.  She will invest in raw materials such as Brazilian leather, biscuit leather, dye, soles, adhesives, insoles, and other items.  Aydalina works with her husband Jaime and they have two children.

loans.use: to buy Brazilian leather, biscuit leather, dye, soles, adhesives, insoles, and other items.

loans.name: Edison Bolivar

texts.es:
Edison es un joven soltero, que vive en "Los Bancos", que es un cantón rural de la Provincia de Pichincha, donde se encuentra la capital del Ecuador. Uno de los principales recursos "Los Bancos" es el hídrico ya que  en su territorio se originan un sin número de riachuelos y pequeñas vertientes que dan paso a ríos de considerable tamaño. Este cantón tiene un gran movimiento comercial que se desenvuelve en la calle principal, donde se encuentran hoteles, restaurantes y almacenes, sobre todo de productos agropecuarios, así como servicios veterinarios y tiendas para el consumo diario de la población.

Por consejos de su madre, Edison inició su propio negocio hace un año. Abrió una tienda de víveres en su sector de residencia. Trabaja un promedio de 12 horas al día y lo ayuda su madre en la atención a sus clientes. Este joven desea invertir en comprar más mercadería y así poder ofrecer a sus clientes mayor surtido de productos y al tener mayores ventas tendrá mayores ingresos. Este es su primer crédito y luego de la evaluación realizada por su asesor de crédito, se ha determinado que podrá pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia y esperamos que algún día lo cumpla.
texts.en:
Edison is a young single man who lives in Los Bancos, a rural canton in the province of Pichincha, where the capital of Ecuador is located.  One of the principal resources in Los Bancos is water, because its territory is the origin of a great number of streams and small springs that give way to rivers of a considerable size.

This canton has a lot of commercial activity on the main street, where there are hotels, restaurants, and stores, above all for agricultural products, as well as veterinary services and stores for the daily consumption needs of the population.

On his mother's advice, Edison started his own business a year ago.  He opened a grocery store in his neighborhood.  He works an average of 12 hours a day and his mother helps him wait on customers.

This young man wants to invest in buying more merchandise to be able to give his customers a better supply of products, and having better sales he will have greater income.  This is his first loan and, after the evaluation done by his loan advisor, it was determined that he will be able to make his payments punctually.

His dream is to have his own house and we hope that one day he realizes this.

loans.use: to buy products for his grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la administración de un comedor, es viuda, vive con una hija de 14 años de edad, el negocio lo tiene en la casa de habitación, su horario es de 7:00am a 9:00pm, trabaja con tres empleadas para atender clientes y ayudar en la preparación de los alimentos, este negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener ingresos con la muerte de su esposo, ella debía valerse por sí misma.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales como aceite, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, carnes, pollos, condimentos, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar la disponibilidad para trabajar elaborando los menús.
La aspiración de María es crecer en el negocio aumentando la disponibilidad de comida, para abastecer a más demanda de los clientes, con la intención de superarse económicamente.
texts.en:
María runs an eatery. She is a widow, and lives with her 14-year-old daughter. She has her business in her home, and her hours are 7:00am to 9:00pm. She works with three employees who help serve customers and prepare the food.

This business came about, because with her husband's death, she needed income. She had to fend for herself. 

Now she is applying for a loan to buy supplies such as cooking oil, sugar, rice, beans, meats, chicken and condiments. This purchase will help her improve the availability of ingredients, so that she can work making the daily meals. María's ambition is to see her business grow by increasing the availability of food in order to supply customer demand. Her goal is to improve her financial situation.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, sugar, rice, beans, meat, chicken and condiments.

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad is a 31-year-old married man from Sahab, Jordan and a father of four children.

Iyad is looking to improve his family's living conditions thus he is requesting a loan of 800 JD to do maintenance for his home.

An aspiration of Iyad is to build a second floor on his house.

loans.use: to do maintenance for his home

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 43-year-old married man from Sahab, Jordan and a father of eight children.

Mahmoud is a construction contractor and he is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase equipment needed for his store and make new decorations.

Mahmoud is looking to open another branch of his store.

loans.use: to purchase equipment needed and make new decorations for the store

loans.name: Wajed

texts.en:
Wajed is a 61-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Wajed is looking to improve her family's living conditions, so she is requesting a loan of 600 JD to do maintenance for her home.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her home

loans.name: Otor

texts.en:
Otor is a 45-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Otor sells many things such as clothes and blankets and many others, and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase various goods for business purposes.

Otor is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase goods for business purposes

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en:
Sabreen is a 30-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children.
 
Sabreen sells clothes and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more clothing for business purposes.

Sabreen is looking to purchase a home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y a la fabricación de ropa, como sastre, ella vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad, ella tiene el negocio desde hace 2 años, surgió por iniciativa propia, lo atiende desde las 6:00am hasta las 4:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de de maíz, gas, leña, para mantener en el negocio, pues estos son sus materiales necesarios para hacer las tortillas, espera fortalecerse y aumentar la producción y ventas.
La aspiración de Karla es que el negocio sea mejor, más rentable, que le ayude para poder apoyar a sus hijos con el estudio.
texts.en:
Karla works selling tortillas and as a tailor making clothing.  She lives with her husband and two children, ages 10 and 8.  She has had the business for two years.  It developed on her own initiative.  She provides service from 6:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn, gas, and firewood to support her business, because these are the necessary materials to make tortillas.  She hopes to grow stronger and increase production and sales.

Karla's goal is for her business to be better and more profitable, to help her be able to support her children's studies.

loans.use: to buy corn, gas, and firewood.

loans.name: Ipa

texts.en:
Ipa is a 27-year-old lady and married to Gilves, a 43-year-old man. They got married last year and are blessed with a baby girl namely, Agnes, 8 months old. Ipa owns a recording studio business and sells petrol. Ipa and husband are seeking money to buy a computer for their recording studio since the old one is broken. 

Fortunately Ipa met a TLM loan officer and got explanation about the individual lending program in her village. She got interested in joining the program and submitted a loan application to request IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. Ipa is hoping that she can improve the business through the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a computer

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 37-year-old lady who is married to Aliman, a 49-year-old man. Salma is blessed with four children who are Eliah, 21; Nabila, 19; Fikri, 14 and Diana, 9 (two of them are still attending school).

Salma runs a shop at the local harbor. She has been running this business for four years. The items that she sells include Balinese sarongs, traditional shawls and fruit (apples, grapes, etc). Her husband, Aliman, also runs the same business on the ship. 

In order to improve her business, Salma needs additional money. She received capital assistance from TLM through a group lending program some years ago. And she said that the loan was very useful for her business. She then decided to apply for a larger loan amount from TLM of IDR 12,000,000. Salma wants to spend the loan to purchase many more things for her business, e.g., Balinese sarongs, fruit and traditional shawls.

loans.use: to purchase a lot more things for the business, e.g., Balinese sarongs, fruits and traditional shawls.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: At the age of 30 years, Emmanuel feels he still has more to achieve especially to turn his retail shop to a wholesale shop. He also wants to buy land for his growing family. Having started from doing farming and growing several crops he sees a brighter future as he still maintains agriculture as another source of income for the family. His dream is to educate his children. He intends to use the loan opportunity to buy sugar to sell in his retail shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar for retail sale.

loans.name: Hendrik

texts.en:
Hendrik is a 41-year-old man who is married to Christiana, and has been blessed with 3 children: Defriano, 9 years old and in the fourth grade of elementary school; Sisi, 4 years old, and Junino, a newborn baby boy. 

Hendrik is a driver and the income he produces from being a driver is regularly insufficient to support his family needs. To overcome his financial problems Hendrik initiated a new business. He set up a kiosk and equipped it with basic commodities such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, snacks, cosmetics, etc.

Now, his business is growing up and he desires to improve his income from that business. He then applied a loan application to TLM and requested a loan amounting to IDR 4,000,000. The loan will be used to stock more rice and buy soft drinks. He believes that the more goods he has to sell, the better income he can generate.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to stock and buy soft drinks

loans.name: Erminia Bautista

texts.es:
Erminia, tiene 38 años de edad, vive con sus 5 hijos, de 12, 14, 16, 18 y 20 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de loza (ollas, comales, sartenes), junto a sus dos hijos mayores, trabajan diariamente, Erminia aprendió desde muy joven y le enseño a sus hijos, para que le ayudaran y pudiera aumentar la producción, ellos elaboran lo comales y ollas de barro, los queman en horno y utilizan otros materiales para dar por finalizado el proceso.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de leña ($100), barro ($50), nacazcol ($25), mano de obra, transporte y otros gastos, haciendo la suma de este préstamo, esta inversión será de gran ayuda para tener la suficiente materia prima y continuar en la elaboración de artesanía.
La aspiración de Erminia es poder ayudar a que sus hijos se superen estudiando, ya que cuando ella creció sus padres eran pobres y no le ayudaron para que se superara, ella por lo mismo quiere que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Erminia is 38 years old and lives with her 5 children, ages 12, 14, 16, 18 and 20. She is dedicated to the development and commercialization of earthenware (pots, griddles, pans). She works daily with her two older children.  Erminia learned the skill at a young age and taught it to her children so they could help her and to increase production.  They make the griddles and pots of clay, burn them in the oven, and then use other materials to finalize the process.  

She is currently seeking a loan for the purchase of wood ($100), clay ($50), nacazcol dye ($25), labor, transportation and other expenses, make up the total sum of the loan. This investment will be a big help in order to have sufficient primary materials and to continue the making of the earthenware handicrafts.

Erminia's aspiration is to help her children complete their studies.  When she was growing up her parents were too poor to help her complete her studies, so she wants her children to have a better future than she did.

loans.use: to purchase wood, clay, nacazcol dye, labor and transportation

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Esperanza” está conformado por 18 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa, atención de un ciber (local publico con acceso a internet), librería, preparación de comida rápida, pastelería, costuras de ropa, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Maribel integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en la primera fila, ubicada en el primer puesto de izquierda a derecha, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y viste con pantalones color café. 
Ella se dedica a atender un almacén de abarrotes y bebidas. Comenta que tiene éste negocio desde hace 5 meses. Su horario de atención es en horario completo, ya que trabaja de 8ºº de la mañana hasta las 10ºº horas de la noche, de lunes a domingo. Debe seguir éste horario debido a que no existe otro almacén a 3 kilómetros y la demanda de clientes es alta. Situación que observa con optimismo, ya que no tiene competencias.
Actualmente también ha incorporado la preparación y venta de pan.
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados mayoristas y distribuidoras de confites.
Con el crédito comprará una vitrina congeladora eléctrica, para guardar sus productos, de ésta manera pretende aumentar su clientela y por ende sus ingresos.
Sus metas son ampliar su local para comenzar con el inicio de actividades, ya que por ahora solo cuenta con un permiso de ventas provisorio. Además comprar una amasadora para facilitar la preparación de pan. 
Maribel vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 6 y 1 año siete meses de edad. Su marido es quien la ayuda con la administración del negocio, durante la semana y también la apoya con el cuidado de sus hijos. 
Sus sueños a nivel personal son obtener su casa propia, ya que por ahora le cedieron un terreno y casa prestados. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo económico brindado por Fondo esperanza, además se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones impartidas, ya que comparte experiencias con otros socios comerciantes y también aprende nuevas estrategias de administración.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Esperanza” and it has 18 entrepreneurs who carry out a variety of lines of work among which are clothes sales, running an Internet café (a public place with access to the Internet), bookstore, fast food production, pastry shop and clothes making, among others; all are from the city of Chillán.

Maribel is a member of the communal bank who is seated in the first row in the photo first from left to right; her hair is dark brown and she’s wearing brown pants.  She runs a grocery and beverage shop.  She comments that she’s had this business for the last five months.  She works full time since she works from 8am until 10pm, Monday to Sunday.  She must follow this schedule because there is no other store for 3 kilometers and customer demand is high, a situation she notes optimistically because she has no competition.  She has recently also added baking and selling bread.  She buys her merchandise in wholesale supermarkets and from snack distributors.

She will use the loan to buy an electric, refrigerated display case to store her products to increase clientele and thus her income.  Her goals are to expand her store to start her activities cycle since she now only has a temporary sales permit.  She will also buy a kneader to make bread making easier.

Maribel lives with her husband and two children who are 6 years and one year and seven months old.  Her dream at a personal level is to obtain a house of her own since she currently lives in a borrowed house and lot.  

She is very happy and grateful for the economic support Fondo Esperanza has granted her.  Besides, she feels very comfortable in the meetings they have because she shares experiences with other merchant members and also learns new administration strategies.

Chillán is a commune in south-central Chile.  Its name means “Seat of the Sun” in Mapudungun, the language of the Mapuche indigenous peoples.  Chillán is also known as the “Birthplace of the Nation” or “Land of Artists” because outstanding personages in Chile’s history were born here like the well-known pianist, Claudio Arrau, for example.

loans.use: to buy an electric, refrigerated display case.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y siembra de granos básicos, vive con su familia, su esposa y cinco hijos,  de los cuales tres dependen económicamente de él, lleva 15 años en el negocio, lo heredo de sus padres, es una labor muy bonita trabajar en el campo, pues Martin así la considera.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de concentrado para el ganado, ya que en época de verano el zacate se seca y debe estar preparado con harinilla y concentrado para alimentarlos, este préstamo le ayudara para tener lo necesario y poder alimentar al ganado.
